nodes.description: 自杀式汽车炸弹袭击了摩加迪沙的海滨餐厅-酒店。
nodes.support_text: At least 20 people died and 17 were wounded after a suicide car bomber and gunmen attacked a beachside restaurant-hotel in the capital of Somalia, authorities said.

nodes.description: 袭击者被确认为al Shabaab恐怖组织的成员。
nodes.support_text: Government forces fought a gun battle with the the attackers, who were identified as members of the al Shabaab terror group.

nodes.description: 20人死亡，17人受伤，6名袭击者被击毙，一名袭击者被俘。
nodes.support_text: At least 20 people died and 17 were wounded after a suicide car bomber and gunmen attacked a beachside restaurant-hotel in the capital of Somalia, authorities said. Six attackers were also killed. The country's security minister said the alleged commander of the attack was captured alive by security forces.

nodes.description: 政府发言人谴责这一野蛮行为，并表示将不会屈服于恐吓。
nodes.support_text: "This is a barbaric act and we condemn this act," government spokesman Abdisalam Aato said. "Al Shabaab is trying to disrupt the peace and Somalis will not stand for it. We will not be intimidated."

nodes.description: 袭击始于当地时间周四晚上7:30，一辆汽车撞向了Liido海鲜餐厅的入口。
nodes.support_text: The attack started about 7:30 p.m. local time Thursday when a car rammed the gate of the Liido Seafood Restaurant overlooking a Mogadishu beach, said Col. Abdulkadir Mohammed, a senior police officer.

nodes.description: 爆炸后，武装分子进入相邻的酒店，部分通过船只进入。
nodes.support_text: After the blast, militants entered the adjoining hotel -- at least some of them by boat -- Mohammed and a Western source in Mogadishu told CNN.

nodes.description: 酒店当时正举办毕业和婚礼仪式。
nodes.support_text: The hotel was crowded with graduation and wedding ceremonies, the National Intelligence & Security Agency (NISA) of Somalia said in a tweet.

nodes.description: 所有平民和工作人员都被救出。
nodes.support_text: All civilians & workers were rescued, Our forces are cleaning the place, — NISA (@HSNQ_NISA) January 21, 2016
All civilians & workers were rescued, Our forces are cleaning the place, — NISA (@HSNQ_NISA) January 21, 2016

edges.support_text: After the blast, militants entered the adjoining hotel -- at least some of them by boat -- Mohammed and a Western source in Mogadishu told CNN.
Government forces fought a gun battle with the the attackers, who were identified as members of the al Shabaab terror group.
"This is a barbaric act and we condemn this act," government spokesman Abdisalam Aato said. "Al Shabaab is trying to disrupt the peace and Somalis will not stand for it. We will not be intimidated."
All civilians & workers were rescued, Our forces are cleaning the place, — NISA (@HSNQ_NISA) January 21, 2016

The attack started about 7:30 p.m. local time Thursday when a car rammed the gate of the Liido Seafood Restaurant overlooking a Mogadishu beach, said Col. Abdulkadir Mohammed, a senior police officer.
After the blast, militants entered the adjoining hotel -- at least some of them by boat -- Mohammed and a Western source in Mogadishu told CNN.
The hotel was crowded with graduation and wedding ceremonies, the National Intelligence & Security Agency (NISA) of Somalia said in a tweet.
All civilians & workers were rescued, Our forces are cleaning the place, — NISA (@HSNQ_NISA) January 21, 2016
